## delegate() function

Create a delegate listener that fires on elements that match the provided selectors, as the event bubbles up through the DOM.

**Signature:**

```typescript
declare function delegate<T extends EventTarget, U extends Event | CustomEvent>(selectors: string, callback: (this: T, delegateEvent: DelegateEvent<U>) => unknown): (this: T, event: U) => void;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

selectors


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

One or more selectors to match.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

callback


</td><td>

(this: T, delegateEvent: [DelegateEvent](./spank-my-dom.delegateevent.md)<!-- -->&lt;U&gt;) =&gt; unknown


</td><td>

The function called for each delegate match.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

(this: T, event: U) =&gt; void

## Example 1

Do something with a matched element.

```ts
document.addEventListener('click', delegate('.foo', ({ delegateTarget }) => {
    console.log(delegateTarget);
}));
```

## Example 2

Stop delegation if there are multiple matches within the event bubble that you don't want to trigger callbacks for.

```ts
document.addEventListener('click', delegate('.foo', ({ stopDelegation }) => {
    if (condition) {
        stopDelegation();
    }
}));
```
